text: [Music]
hey guys it's angel today I'm going to
share with you a quick and easy
Taiwanese soup recipe which is a
homestyle soup recipe it is a daikon
radish and pork based soup and in
Taiwanese we call it soup pipe Alton
it's really clean tasting and it's a
little bit sweet from the daikon but
it's one of those tips where when you
drink it you're kind of like messily
grandma would have made and yes my
grandma makes this all the time and this
is her homestyle recipe so I'm sharing
this with you guys
and I hope you guys enjoy so with that
let's get started so this recipe only
needs a few simple ingredients we are
going to start with pork bones now I
recommend buying pork bones that are
pork spareribs which are easy to cut
into little 1-inch pieces but you can
use any type of pork cut that you'd like
just keep in mind that it doesn't have
to be the most expensive cut of pork
because we're going to be using this for
our soup next we're going to need some
daikon radish now if you go to the
grocery store you're going to see
radishes like this which are a little
bit thicker but you might also see some
thinner daikon radishes grandma says
that these thicker ones are sweeter for
you some soup so I recommend getting the
thicker one we're going to cut up an
equal amount of daikon as you have in
pork bones and we're just going to
eyeball it because that's how Graeme
used to do it
and for a little bit of extra flavor I'm
just going to add one clove of smashed
garlic just be warned that you'll
probably have garlic ran after this
[Music]
after you have all those ingredients
prepared we're going to place the pork
into a saucepan add just enough water to
cover the pork bring that to a boil and
we're going to let that fork blanch for
five minutes
now if you're wondering when we do this
blanching step it's really going to help
remove the impurities and the blood from
the inside of the pork bones making for
a cleaner soup once it's done blanching
remove the clean pork bones set that
aside and discard the water now with a
clean soup pot we're going to add our
pork bones our daikon radish and also
our smashed garlic fill that up with
filtered water then let your soup boil
for 30 to 45 minutes or until your
daikon is off you'll know when your
daikons done when you can take one
chopstick and poke it and it goes right
through finally when the soup is done I
want you guys to stop and do the taste
test taste a little bit of the soup and
I want you guys to taste how sweet the
daikon is without the salt finally go
ahead and add some salt to your soup to
taste now this is a big pot of soup so
feel free to be generous with the salt
next serve your soup pot and garnish
with some green onions or cilantro
[Music]
so that's how you make a Taiwanese
daikon and pork ribs soup also known as
type alkanes there's many variations on
this you can maybe add some Tomatoes
maybe some carrots doesn't only go ahead
and feel free to make it your own so
with that I'm going to do the taste test
mmm mmm soup is really good I'm going to
try some daikon mmm I love daikon thumbs
up if you guys like daikon - thank you
guys so much for watching if you haven't
subscribed to my channel already please
do so it'd really mean a lot to me I
hope you guys enjoyed this video and I
will see you guys soon bye
so good one-nothing
